inputs.note:
Patient: James Wilson
DOB: 11/22/1958 | MRN: MRN-4592

Discharge Summary — Cardiology Service

Principal Diagnosis: Anterior STEMI
Intervention: Drug-eluting stent (DES) to LAD, day 3 post-PCI

Hospital Course: 68M admitted via EMS with substernal chest pain and ST-elevation in V1-V4. Emergent cath showed 95% LAD occlusion. Successful DES placement. Post-procedure course uncomplicated.

Echo: LVEF 40% with anterior wall hypokinesis
Troponin I peaked at 12.5 ng/mL

Discharge Medications:
  - Aspirin 81mg daily
  - Atorvastatin 80mg daily
  - Lisinopril 5mg daily
  - Clopidogrel 75mg daily

Follow-up: Cardiology in 2 weeks. Cardiac rehab referral placed.
